page.title: 19WHITEHAVEN HARBOUR & DOCK.
page.content: Whitehaven harbour & dock were once very busy but times have changed. Almost all the original quays & piers remain as they were when John Paul Jones made his famous attack on the busy port in the 18th. century.At that time rum,sugar and slaves were the main imports.Most of the cargo going out of the the harbour was coal.The Heyday of coal in Whitehaven was in 1927/28 when the total broke 400,000 tons.The west pier was completed in 1838 & was designed by John Rennie.The 'wet dock' is Queen's Dock and is still used today.It can accommodate ships up to 3000 gross tons with a maximum length of 270feet & a draught of 18 feet.The main export is coal to Ireland & Marchon Products import phosphate rock from N.Africa. "Clearway" is the last working coal fired steam dredger in the country.
